image.altText: anthony albanese

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese expresses his astonishment at claims made by Israel's prime minister that "there is no starvation in Gaza", telling Labor MPs that statement is "beyond comprehension".

title.children: PM expresses astonishment at Israel's denial of starvation in Gaza

props.synopsis: Under Donald Trump's tariff program, Australia appeared to be one of America's least badly treated friends. But, without a new deal, the president's latest idea would change that.

title.children: Australia may no longer be Trump's least badly treated friend

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit and tie with big smile as he shows his Medicare card in parliament

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese brings out his Medicare card again as Labor is grilled in parliament about its bulk-billing pledge. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese whips out Medicare card as Labor grilled about bulk-billing pledge

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tehan booted for calling Labor minister a 'clown'
The PM's Medicare card has made an appearance ... again!
Question Time has started with a welcome to Tuvalu's PM

image.altText: A girl in her 20s with green eyes looks straight at the camera wearings timber Aboriginal designed earrings

props.synopsis: With more than 600 Indigenous deaths in custody since the royal commission, First Nations families say the staggering toll is Australia's shame.

title.children: Apryl's mother fell asleep on a train, then died alone in a police cell

image.altText: Ross Garnaut

props.synopsis: The father of emissions trading in Australia has warned the nation is "on a path to comprehensive failure" without the urgent reintroduction of a carbon price.

title.children: Australia can 'spend a fortune to buy failure' or reintroduce a carbon price

image.altText: Two hailstones sitting in the palm of a hand.

props.synopsis: The frequency of "giant" hail and the number of hail days in a season could increase substantially for multiple Australian cities as the climate warms, a new study has found.

title.children: Giant hail threat increases for Australian cities as climate warms

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The ASX follows European markets lower as traders evaluate the US-EU trade deal and a new threat by the US president to implement a 15-20 per cent "baseline" tariff. Follow the events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX falls as trade optimism fades, Trump flags 15-20pc 'baseline' tariff

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Reintroducing a carbon price the 'most economically efficient tax reform' to repair budget
Giant hail threat increases for Australian cities as climate warms
ATO system is back online after major disruption

image.altText: A glass door with the Ramsay Psychology words and logo on it.

props.synopsis: Face-to-face mental health support saved Kate's life, now her health care provider wants her to move to telehealth instead.

title.children: Clients 'disgusted and appalled' by Ramsay psychology clinic shutdowns

image.altText: A torch pointed at a white patch.

props.synopsis: The ABC's Foreign Correspondent travels to cartel country in Mexico to see if the government's crackdown on drug cartels is working.

title.children: The 'astounding' secret police discovered under a Mexican cartel town

image.altText: A light-coloured single-storey building with green lawn, a driveway and metal gates in front.

props.synopsis: A Queensland childcare worker has been charged with torturing and repeatedly assaulting a one-year-old baby boy.

title.children: Educator charged with torturing baby boy in childcare centre

image.altText: A woman sitting on a deck chair with green grass behind her

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of Australians slugged more than $60 million in excessive bank fees could soon get a refund, but Commonwealth Bank customers may not see a cent of $270 million in unfair charges.

title.children: Commbank refuses to pay millions in refunds to low-income customers

image.altText: ny shooting

props.synopsis: A gunman has killed four people, including an off-duty police officer, in a New York office building before taking his own life, officials say.

title.children: Five dead in New York office building shooting, including gunman

image.altText: Aerial of sheep wandering among the solar panels at Numurkah solar farm

props.synopsis: The approval of a solar farm in just 30 business days is an example of how the renewables rollout could be sped up if Australia's ageing environment laws were rewritten, the government says.

title.children: A solar farm approved in weeks shows how renewables rollout could be sped up

image.altText: A close up photo of an older man with glasses and a receding hairline

props.synopsis: Sir Michael Hill, the founder of jewellery brand Michael Hill, has died aged 86. The company has remembered its founder as a "celebrated jeweller, entrepreneur [and] philanthropist".

title.children: Jewellery tycoon Michael Hill dies after taking leave for cancer treatment

image.altText: Lili Greer as a child hugging her mum Tina

props.synopsis: While Lili says her experience with violence and loss will have lifelong impacts, advocating for change has been part of her healing.

title.children: Advocating to end gender-based violence has helped Lili keep her mum's memory alive

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Rick McGary, who has been on trial three times for rape, is now behind bars after a jury found him guilty of two charges against two women.

title.children: Former Canberra academic found guilty of raping two women

image.altText: A smiling woman with blond hair wearing a short blue dress sits outside

props.synopsis: The Vogue spread has sparked significant controversy, with some claiming it threatens diversity in fashion and reinforces already unattainable beauty standards.

title.children: Her features are flawless. But this blonde model in Vogue isn't real

image.altText: a vehicle running over a crocodile at a river crossing

props.synopsis: A video of a large crocodile becoming stuck underneath a ute at a notorious river crossing in the Northern Territory has gone viral online.

title.children: Video shows crocodile stuck under ute as it crosses NT river

image.altText: Exterior of the District Court in Townsville

props.synopsis: A Queensland man has been jailed for blackmail after extorting $1.7 million from a woman across 10 years, threatening to expose their past affair.

title.children: Man jailed for 10 years for blackmailing former lover out of $1.7m

image.altText: A couple wearing heavy winter clothing pose on top of Bluff Knoll

props.synopsis: Snow chasers have three opportunities in eight days to frolic in the white stuff on peaks in Stirling Range National Park.

title.children: Hikers in WA's south enjoy three snowy days in just over a week

image.altText: A woman sits with her hands folded on her lap looking into the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: A mother found not guilty of attempted murder by way of mental incompetence after stabbing her two sons multiple times on an Adelaide motorway, has been sentenced to a limited fixed term of 12 years in a mental health facility.

title.children: Adelaide mother sentenced to time in mental health facility after stabbing sons

image.altText: A man in a blue suit, purple tie and white shirt stands speaking behind a lectern decorated with flowers

props.synopsis: Taiwan's president is set to delay a diplomatically sensitive trip his team had floated to the US because of ongoing US–China trade talks, according to sources familiar with the matter.

title.children: Taiwan to push back US stopover amid US–China trade talks, sources say

image.altText: Black and white photo of a man holding the steering wheel of a car with his left had. He has a watch on his wrist.

props.synopsis: Some Uber riders are pay up to three times the cost of their trip, with reports of drivers manipulating the system to make more money.

title.children: Uber drivers creating artificial surge prices

image.altText: A line of coal train carriages in front of a coal washer machine which is partially covered in fog.

props.synopsis: The mine has cut two-thirds of its workforce as its debt continues to climb past the $800 million mark.

title.children: Troubled NSW coal mine to sack 100 plus workers in mass redundancies

image.altText: Houses close to the shore with rocks in front of them on a small peninsula jutting into the ocean.

props.synopsis: Property owners in the SA town of Pelican Point may be sceptical of predictions their town will be under water in 75 years but they are tired of waiting for authorities to act.

title.children: Homeowners take battle with the sea into their own hands

image.altText: A man with long white hair looks down at his phone while walking down the steps of a court building.

props.synopsis: Chris Marco, 67, is on trial in Perth accused of defrauding more than 100 investors out of tens of millions of dollars, but his lawyers says he believed he was operating a legitimate investment business.

title.children: Accused fraudster raised $250m from investors, 'promised pot of gold'

image.altText: A close-up of Jim Chalmers in front of a grey background

props.synopsis: There's a great deal riding on the contentious proposal, politically for the Albanese government, personally for Treasurer Jim Chalmers and economically for the nation.

title.children: Gas shortage crisis develops as Santos takeover heats up

image.altText: A woman speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: The University of Queensland has defended the "fundamental principles of freedom of speech" of researchers who pushed conspiracy theories and misinformation around fire ant treatments and vaccines.

title.children: Academics criticised for stances on fire ant treatment, vaccines

image.altText: A lage building surrounded by snow

props.synopsis: Experts warn Russia and China's plans to expand their presence in Antarctica may be linked to mining or military ambitions in the designated nature reserve.

title.children: Russian and Chinese plans for Antarctic expansion spark alarm

image.altText: Sandy with a dog selfie

props.synopsis: Sandy Robson worked as a flight attendant for three decades, before COVID presented her with the chance to switch things up.

title.children: Why I quit my job as a flight attendant and started chauffeuring pets

image.altText: women wearing headscarves carry white cloth with green and red Arabic script. Behind are signs in English and Arabic.

props.synopsis: A viral video of the "honour killing" of a woman and her lover in Pakistan has ignited national outrage, prompting scrutiny of longstanding tribal codes and calls for justice in a country where such killings often pass in silence.

title.children: Viral video of Pakistani 'honour' killing triggers national outrage

image.altText: Conceptual illustration of a pair of entangled quantum particles interacting at a distance.

props.synopsis: When a German physicist returned from a health retreat 100 years ago, his ideas sparked a debate about reality, and gave rise to quantum mechanics — the "spooky" science of the very small.

title.children: 100 years ago, a mind-bending idea was born that would prove Einstein wrong

image.altText: Looking up at the pillars outside the Victorian Parliament.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will move to make it even harder for repeat offenders to get bail when parliament resumes today, while the opposition and Greens will scrutinise scandals in the childcare sector.

title.children: Education department to be probed in Greens' parliamentary inquiry into childcare

image.altText: A stressed female worker looking overwhelmed with things shoved in her face like a phone, diary and watch

props.synopsis: When the pressure is on, it's easy to skip a break to focus on work. But not taking breaks can quickly become a dangerous habit.

title.children: Skipping a work break can cause us long-term harm

image.altText: An orange ute with bonnet up and doors open, in a showroom.

props.synopsis: Electric vehicles are accelerating in the Australian market, but there are concerns over charging access, affordability and looming tax changes that could stall progress.

title.children: 'Cheaper' electric vehicles flood Australia but face roadblocks
